message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.AR

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Science sub-category of Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) as it presents an Information-Centric Network architecture that supports content routing by mapping content names to IP flows. It also uses OpenFlow switches to achieve content routing over a legacy IP architecture. 

It could also belong to the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) as it discusses content management, content caching, and content routing at the network layer, which are all important aspects of network security. 

Additionally, it could be classified under Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) as it presents a network architecture that enables efficient content routing and management in distributed systems. 

It could also be classified under Systems and Control (cs.SY) as it discusses the use of a modified controller to support content routing in the network layer. 

Finally, it could be classified under Architecture (cs.AR) as it presents an architecture specification for ContentFlow, an Information-Centric network architecture that supports content routing.
